briefdescription.para: Market Helpers

detaileddescription.para: All margin positions are force closed at the swan price Collateral received goes into a force-settlement fund No new margin positions can be created for this asset No more price feed updates Force settlement happens without delay at the swan price, deducting from force-settlement fund No more asset updates may be issued.

inbodydescription.para: After all margin positions are closed, the current supply will be reported as 0, but that is a lie, the supply didn't change. We need to capture the current supply before filling all call orders and then restore it afterward. Then in the force settlement evaluator reduce the supply

briefdescription.para: Process a new limit order through the markets.

detaileddescription.para:
order
The new order to process
true if order was completely filled; false otherwise This function takes a new limit order, and runs the markets attempting to match it with existing orders already on the books.
Matches the two orders,
a bit field indicating which orders were filled (and thus removed) 0 - no orders were matched 1 - bid was filled 2 - ask was filled 3 - both were filled

memberdef.argsstring: (const call_order_object &call, const force_settlement_object &settle, const price &match_price, asset max_settlement)
memberdef.name: match

inbodydescription.para: If the least collateralized call position lacks sufficient collateral to cover at the match price then this indicates a black swan event according to the price feed, but only the market can trigger a black swan. So now we must cancel the forced settlement object.

detaileddescription.para: Steps involved in applying a new block

let HB = the highest bid for the collateral (aka who will pay the most DEBT for the least collateral) let SP = current median feed's Settlement Price let LC = the least collateralized call order's swan price (debt/collateral)
If there is no valid price feed or no bids then there is no black swan.
A black swan occurs if MAX(HB,SP) <= LC
Steps performed only at maintenance intervals
Update the budget for witnesses and workers.

inbodydescription.para: accounts that vote for 0 or 1 witness do not get to express an opinion on the number of witnesses to have (they abstain and are non-voting accounts)
accounts that vote for 0 or 1 witness do not get to express an opinion on the number of witnesses to have (they abstain and are non-voting accounts)

detaileddescription.para: This signal is emitted after all operations and virtual operation for a block have been applied but before the get_applied_operations() are cleared.
You may not yield from this callback because the blockchain is holding the write lock and may be in an "inconstant state" until after it is released.
This signal is emitted any time a new transaction is added to the pending block state.

memberdef.type: fc::signal< void(const vector< object_id_type > &, const flat_set< account_id_type > &)>
memberdef.name: new_objects

detaileddescription.para: Emitted After a block has been applied and committed. The callback should not yield and should execute quickly.

memberdef.type: fc::signal< void(const vector< object_id_type > &, const flat_set< account_id_type > &)>
memberdef.name: changed_objects

detaileddescription.para: Emitted After a block has been applied and committed. The callback should not yield and should execute quickly.

memberdef.type: fc::signal< void(const vector< object_id_type > &, const vector< const object * > &, const flat_set< account_id_type > &)>
memberdef.definition: fc::signal<void(const vector<object_id_type>&, const vector<const object*>&, const flat_set<account_id_type>&)> graphene::chain::database::removed_objects
memberdef.name: removed_objects

detaileddescription.para: this signal is emitted any time an object is removed and contains a pointer to the last value of every object that was removed.
when popping a block, the transactions that were removed get cached here so they can be reapplied at the proper time
Note: we can probably store blocks by block num rather than block id because after the undo window is past the block ID is no longer relevant and its number is irreversible.
During the "fork window" we can cache blocks in memory until the fork is resolved. This should make maintaining the fork tree relatively simple.

Contains the set of ops that are in the process of being applied from the current block. It contains real and virtual operations in the order they occur and is cleared after the applied_block signal is emited.

briefdescription.para: Open a database, creating a new one if necessary.

detaileddescription.para: Opens a database in the specified directory. If no initialized database is found, genesis_loader is called and its return value is used as the genesis state when initializing the new database
genesis_loader will not be called if an existing database is found.

parameterdescription.para: Path to open or create database in
A callable object which returns the genesis state to initialize new databases on

briefdescription.para: Rebuild object graph from block history and open detabase.

detaileddescription.para: This method may be called after or instead of database::open, and will rebuild the object graph by replaying blockchain history. When this method exits successfully, the database will be open.

briefdescription.para: wipe Delete database from disk, and potentially the raw chain as well.

detaileddescription.para:
include_blocks
If true, delete the raw chain as well as the database.
Will close the database before wiping. Database will be closed when this function returns.

simplesect.para: true if the block is in our fork DB or saved to disk as part of the official chain, otherwise return false

detaileddescription.para: Only return true if the transaction has not expired or been invalidated. If this method is called with a VERY old transaction we will return false, they should query things by blocks if they are that old.
Calculate the percent of block production slots that were missed in the past 128 blocks, not including the current block.
Push block "may fail" in which case every partial change is unwound. After push block is successful the block is appended to the chain database on disk.

simplesect.para: true if we switched forks as a result of this push.

detaileddescription.para: Attempts to push the transaction into the pending queue

When called to push a locally generated transaction, set the skip_block_size_check bit on the skip argument. This will allow the transaction to be pushed even if it causes the pending block size to exceed the maximum block size. Although the transaction will probably not propagate further now, as the peers are likely to have their pending queues full as well, it will be kept in the queue to be propagated later when a new block flushes out the pending queues.

inbodydescription.para: TODO: if the block is greater than the head block and before the next maitenance interval

parameterdescription.para: if the proposed transaction fails to apply.

memberdef.argsstring: (const fc::time_point_sec when, witness_id_type witness_id, const fc::ecc::private_key &block_signing_private_key, uint32_t skip)
memberdef.name: generate_block

memberdef.argsstring: (const fc::time_point_sec when, witness_id_type witness_id, const fc::ecc::private_key &block_signing_private_key)
memberdef.name: _generate_block

detaileddescription.para: Removes the most recent block from the database and undoes any changes it made.

This method is used to track appied operations during the evaluation of a block, these operations should include any operation actually included in a transaction as well as any implied/virtual operations that resulted, such as filling an order. The applied operations is cleared after applying each block and calling the block observers which may want to index these operations.

simplesect.para: the op_id which can be used to set the result after it has finished being applied.

briefdescription.para: Get the witness scheduled for block production in a slot.

detaileddescription.para: slot_num always corresponds to a time in the future.
If slot_num == 1, returns the next scheduled witness. If slot_num == 2, returns the next scheduled witness after 1 block gap.
Use the get_slot_time() and get_slot_at_time() functions to convert between slot_num and timestamp.
Passing slot_num == 0 returns GRAPHENE_NULL_WITNESS
Get the time at which the given slot occurs.
If slot_num == 0, return time_point_sec().
If slot_num == N for N > 0, return the Nth next block-interval-aligned time greater than head_block_time().
Get the last slot which occurs AT or BEFORE the given time.
The return value is the greatest value N such that get_slot_time( N ) <= when.
If no such N exists, return 0.

briefdescription.para: Helper to make lazy deposit to CDD VBO.

detaileddescription.para: If the given optional VBID is not valid(), or it does not have a CDD vesting policy, or the owner / vesting_seconds of the policy does not match the parameter, then credit amount to newly created VBID and return it.
Otherwise, credit amount to ovbid.

simplesect.para: ID of newly created VBO, but only if VBO was created.

detaileddescription.para: This method dumps the state of the blockchain in a semi-human readable form for the purpose of tracking down funds and mismatches in currency allocation

memberdef.argsstring: (const limit_order_object &order, const asset &pays, const asset &receives, bool cull_if_small)
memberdef.name: fill_order

simplesect.para: true if the order was completely filled and thus freed.

detaileddescription.para: Starting with the least collateralized orders, fill them if their call price is above the max(lowest bid,call_limit).
This method will return true if it filled a short or limit

parameterdescription.para: - the market issued asset that should be called.
- when adjusting collateral, triggering a black swan is invalid and will throw if enable_black_swan is not set to true.

simplesect.para: true if a margin call was executed.

detaileddescription.para:
This method validates transactions without adding it to the pending state.
true if the transaction would validate

briefdescription.para: tracks the blockchain state in an extensible manner
